quote: The writer who loses his self-doubt, who gives way as he grows old to a sudden euphoria, to prolixity, should stop writing immediately: the time has come for him to lay aside his pen.
quote_letters: THE WRITER WHO LOSES HIS SELF-DOUBT WHO GIVES WAY AS HE GROWS OLD TO A SUDDEN EUPHORIA TO PROLIXITY SHOULD STOP WRITING IMMEDIATELY THE TIME HAS COME FOR HIM TO LAY ASIDE HIS PEN
